main event: An unidentified flying object was observed on 23 April 1962 at an elevation of 14,000 feet, appearing as a bright star or planet.
interesting points: The object hovered before disappearing behind clouds at a 35-degree elevation., At one point, the object's brightness increased to half that of Venus., The object was seen moving almost straight down at an angle of approximately 65 degrees to the horizon., The sighting lasted an unknown length of time and took place at 2:37/13Z., The object vanished from view around 16:04.
sighted object: a round, white light size of the full moon
witness description: no specific witnesses detailed in the report
